product.name: In the Simulation team at PwC, we used AnyLogic Professional, which is java-based. The majority of my work consisted of modifying simulations using Java, and creating/modifying API's.
In a group at University, we created a networked platformer game using Java, with only JavaFX.
Implemented a variety of searching and sorting algorithms, such as Dijkstras algorithm, to assist in completing university assignments.
Used for the front-end of the full stack product I created at PwC. Also embedded PowerBI into the wesbite.
Used to create the back-end for the product I built at PwC. Integrated multiple micro-services I created for the product.
My personal laptop has an Ubuntu VM which I use for most Computer Science projects.
Using both MacOS and Linux, I'm comfortable using bash, and have written some basic bash scripts for Computer Science projects.

This year I completed a Networking/ Distributing Systems course. While it was theoretical, we learnt about leader rlection in a token ring and consensus regarding both synchronous and unsynchronous systems.
I have used GitHub in various Computer Science projects.
GitLab is the primary git system used by my University, and as such I have used it for many projects and am currently using it for my final year project.
I used git within Azure DevOps for my main project at PwC.
For the project at PwC, I used SQL Server hosted within Google Cloud to create for a relational database. In the past I have also sed mySQL and SQLlite.
Before using SQL Server for the project I worked on at PwC, I first implemented MongoDB into the stack. Eventually I pivotted to SQL as the advantages of a relational database were needed.
